channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Why Syria's Military Imploded So Quickly
item.description:
Former Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad depended on his military to keep him in power for years. Then in just a matter of days, that same feared military disintegrated as rebel groups took control of the country. Our reporter in Damascus talks to former military members to understand why the military collapsed so fast.

Support our non-profit journalism by joining NPR+ at Plus.NPR.org
item.content:encoded:
Former Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad depended on his military to keep him in power for years. Then in just a matter of days, that same feared military disintegrated as rebel groups took control of the country. Our reporter in Damascus talks to former military members to understand why the military collapsed so fast.

Support our non-profit journalism by joining NPR+ at Plus.NPR.org
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Dozens of prisoners allege a culture of violence by guards at federal facility in Virginia
item.description: At a federal prison in rural Virginia, more than 50 prisoners say they've been abused. But when they try to file a complaint — they're stopped, often by the same guards they say are abusing them.
item.content:encoded: At a federal prison in rural Virginia, more than 50 prisoners say they've been abused. But when they try to file a complaint — they're stopped, often by the same guards they say are abusing them.
item.dc:creator: Christie Thompson

item.title: Dreaming of a white Christmas? There's hope, depending on where you live
item.description: A few parts of the country may get a white Christmas in 2024, but the majority will not. And in the future, shifts in weather patterns driven by global warming may make them even less likely.
item.content:encoded:
A few parts of the country may get a white Christmas in 2024, but the majority will not. And in the future, shifts in weather patterns driven by global warming may make them even less likely.

(Image credit: Nati Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Bird flu update: California declares emergency and U.S. sees 1st severe human case
item.description: A person in Louisiana has been hospitalized after being exposed to sick and dead birds. Meanwhile, California has declared an emergency over its growing outbreak in cattle.
item.content:encoded:
A person in Louisiana has been hospitalized after being exposed to sick and dead birds. Meanwhile, California has declared an emergency over its growing outbreak in cattle.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Turkey looks set to play an outsize role in shaping the new Syria after Assad
item.description: As the world watches Syria grapple with the aftermath of Bashar al-Assad's brutal regime and the formation of a new government, one neighbor has emerged as having great influence over the new Syria.
item.content:encoded:
As the world watches Syria grapple with the aftermath of Bashar al-Assad's brutal regime and the formation of a new government, one neighbor has emerged as having great influence over the new Syria.

(Image credit: Yasin Akgul)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: The Federal Reserve lowers interest rates again -- but hints at fewer cuts next year
item.description: The Fed lowered interest rates by a quarter percentage point — but stocks slumped after policymakers projected fewer rate cuts next year as inflation remains elevated.
item.content:encoded:
The Fed lowered interest rates by a quarter percentage point — but stocks slumped after policymakers projected fewer rate cuts next year as inflation remains elevated.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: With a January ban looming, TikTok's future in the U.S. is more uncertain than ever
item.description: A new law gives TikTok a Jan. 19 deadline to sell to a non-Chinese company or face a nationwide ban. Law professor Alan Rozenshtein explains what this means and how President-elect Trump might intervene.
item.content:encoded: A new law gives TikTok a Jan. 19 deadline to sell to a non-Chinese company or face a nationwide ban. Law professor Alan Rozenshtein explains what this means and how President-elect Trump might intervene.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Genital herpes is a 'forgotten' virus. But that doesn't mean it's gone away.
item.description: Over 800 million people have genital herpes — and in many cases the virus can flare up over a person's lifetime, causing painful symptoms. So why doesn't the world pay more attention?
item.content:encoded:
Over 800 million people have genital herpes — and in many cases the virus can flare up over a person's lifetime, causing painful symptoms. So why doesn't the world pay more attention?

(Image credit: BSIP/Universal Images Group via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Supreme Court agrees to review TikTok ban-or-sale law
item.description: The high court said Wednesday it will review a challenge submitted by TikTok asking for the overturn of a law that could ban the video-sharing app by Jan 19.
item.content:encoded:
The high court said Wednesday it will review a challenge submitted by TikTok asking for the overturn of a law that could ban the video-sharing app by Jan 19.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Supreme Court takes up South Carolina's effort to defund Planned Parenthood
item.description: The state cut off funding to Planned Parenthood because it provided non-abortion services to Medicaid patients.
item.content:encoded:
The state cut off funding to Planned Parenthood because it provided non-abortion services to Medicaid patients.

(Image credit: Kent Nishimura)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg
